system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Amygdala Amplifier Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Part of a joint research study into Wookiee psychology, this chip magnifies the fight-or-flight response to induce raw strength drawn from the emotions. Characters without the Rage species trait gain the Rage species trait. This allows them to, once per day, fly into a Rage as a Swift Action, which grants them a +2 bonus on melee attack and damage rolls but renders them unable to use Skills that require concentration, such as Mechanics. A fit of Rage lasts for a number of rounds equal to 5 + the recipients Constitution modifier.

Characters already possessing the Rage species trait increase their bonus to attack and damage rolls while Raging to +3, and gain additional rounds of Rage equal to their Constitution score, and gain a +2 Equipment bonus to their Will Defense while Raging.

Regardless of if the recipient naturally possesses the Rage species trait or not, this Implant takes a massive toll on the body, and replaces the standard post-Rage penalties with -2 Persistent steps down the Condition Track that can only be removed after one hour of recuperation, where no strenuous activity can take place. During this hour, the owner of this implant suffers a temporary -2 penalty to their Wisdom score.

This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Avionics Interface Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Rejection Attack Bonus: +4

Favored by the best pilots across the galaxy, the Avionics Interface is a small HMD placed next to one of the recipient's eyes. It displays a variety of advanced information, including predicted flight paths, missile trajectories, and analyses of environmental conditions directly to the pilot to inform the many split-second decisions they may make on any mission. An Avionics Interface grants a +2 Equipment bonus to all Pilot skill checks. Once per encounter as a Free Action, the user can increase the bonus to +5, but moves -1 Persistent step down the Condition Track that can only be removed by resting for an hour as their brain is assailed with massive amounts of information in an instant.

changes.value: Special: Recipient must possess the Implant Training feat before installation can be attempted

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Biofeedback Regulator Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Rejection Attack Bonus: +13

Special: Recipient must possess the Implant Training feat before installation can be attempted

After getting used to the way Implants affect the body, this cybernetic can be installed to allow more than one to be active at a time. Using an electrical system along the spine that stabilizes the body against the unusual activity caused by Implants, this cybernetic allows its user to have a number of additional active Implants equal to their Constitution modifier (minimum two active Implants at a time). However, the added electrical circuits react strongly to both Ion and Stun effects, and do not halve its damage.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

Body Spikes are hard, bony protrusions that grow in a roughly conical or crescent shape out of the bones of the Bio-Implant recipient. Body Spikes automatically deal 1d4 piercing and slashing damage to any opponent Grapples or is Grappled by the recipient; this damage occurs at the end of the recipient's turn as long as the Grapple is maintained.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +14

The BioTech Borg Construct AJ-6 provides a direct cabled or wireless link to computers and networks within a 10-meter range. It allows a cyborg to remotely program and access on-board data through thought alone. The standard model has a built-in cybord/droid interface and up to four BioTech Knowledge Cartridges or standard Datacard ports (at 500 credits per port beyond the first). Knowledge Cartridges use proprietary technology to achieve Intelligence 4 (instead of Intelligence 2 for a standard Datacard), cost 100 credits each, and are not widely available. BioTech Borg Construct AJ-6s cannot be self-installed.

Characters wearing a BioTech Borg Construct AJ-6 gain a +2 beneficial circumstance bonus to Use Computer, Knowledge, and other Skills at the discretion of the Gamemaster. They can also use Issue Routine Commands as a Swift Action (or as a Free Action if they have the Gimmick Talent). Wearers become more computerlike and less able to relate to people, causing them to take a -5 penalty to all Persuasion checks. They also speak less frequently as they grow accustomed to the speed of communicating through electronic networks.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

The Bio-Stabilizer Implant stores and transmits basic knowledge of various Poisons and Toxins into the mind of it's user, teaching the brain to synthesize antidotes. The user of a Bio-Stabilizer Implant is immune to Poison.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

A Cardio Implant encourages the brain to send vital chemicals to the heart and other organs, revitalizing them and giving the user greater physical reserves. The user of a Cardio Implant gains +1 Hit Point per Character Level.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
Prosthetic replacements in the Star Wars universe frequently take the form of mechanical simulations powered by tiny high-capacity battery packs and motivated by the recipient's bioelectrical impulses. In effect, someone who loses a limb or an extremity can have an electronic replacement that acts (and in some cases looks) just like the original.

Cybernetic Prosthetic devices are unusual, but hardly rare. Luke Skywalker gains a cybernetic replacement for his right hand, lost in battle against Darth Vader- who in turn had much of his own body replaced with cybernetics years before.

Attaching a Cybernetic Prosthesis requires the Cybernetic Surgery Feat. Once attached, the cybernetic replacement performs as well as the original limb or extremity. Common Cybernetic Prosthetics include arms, hands, legs, feet, and various organs. In addition to the cost of the prosthesis, the recipient must also cover the cost of the surgery (typically 500 credits).

Unlike other creatures, a creature with Cybernetic Prosthetics takes full damage from weapons and attacks that deal Ion Damage.

Because The Force is present in all living things, but not machines, creatures with a Cybernetic Prosthetic take a -1 penalty on Use the Force checks for each prosthetic replacement they possess (to a maximum penalty of -5).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

More common and less risky than other Yuuzhan Vong Bio-Implants, Cosmetic Enhancements include tattoos, reshaping of bone structure, alterations to skin or hair color, superficial scarring, the addition of bony protrusions, and so forth. These cosmetic changes do not require an attack roll against the recipient's Fortitude Defense and ignore the normal rules for penalties on Use the Force checks. Cosmetic Enhancements do not alter the statistics of their recipients in any way.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

The Combat Implant stores and transmits basic knowledge on a variety of weapons into the mind of its user. A Combat Implant eliminates penalties to attack rolls for weapons the user is not proficient with.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Droid Brain Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Rejection Attack Bonus: +15

Replacing over 80% of the individual's biological brain, this cybernetic dramatically improves intellect. When successfully installed, the user benefits from a permanent +2 bonus to their Intelligence score and gains immunity to all Mind-Affecting effects. It also functions as a Memory Implant, allowing a user to reroll any Knowledge check, keeping the better of the two results.

Because of the high risk involved in replacing so much of the brain, the user of a Droid Brain suffers a permanent -4 penalty to their Intelligence score if the cybernetic succeeds on its attack against their Fortitude Defense.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

A unique Cybernetic Prosthesis, the Energy-Binding Prosthesis uses an energy bind in place of a mechanical limb, with a standard cybernetic hand connected to a energy field tied to the wielder's missing limb. The arm has an effective Strength score of 8 at Small size, an effective Strength score of 10 at Medium size, and an effective Strength score of 12 at Large size. By manipulating the energy binding in combat, the wielder can disrupt an opponent's Personal Energy Shield as well as some other force fields. The Energy-Binding Prosthesis requires an Energy Cell to operate, and the Energy Cell must be replaced every 48 hours.

Shield Breaker

To disrupt an energy field, the wielder must be adjacent to the target and make a successful Unarmed strike. If the attack hits, Energy Shields with an Shield Rating of 15 or lower are disabled and provide no protection for the rest of the encounter. If the Energy Shield has a Shield Rating greater than 15, the Shield Rating drops by -5, failing once it falls to SR 15 or lower. An Energy-Binding Prosthesis is ineffective against targets more than one size category larger than it.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

The Enhanced Vision Bio-Implant replaces one or both of the recipient's eyes with specially grown creatures that have exceptional sensory perception. A creature with the Enhanced Vision Bio-Implant gains the Darkvision special quality.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

EMPS (Expedited Metabolic Processing System) Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Rejection Attack Bonus: +14

Using a combination of mechanical and chemical processes, an Expedited Metabolic Processing System (or EMPS) reinvigorates someone when it matters most. Whenever a user catches their Second Wind, they can gain Fast Healing equal to their Constitution modifier for a number of rounds equal to their Constitution modifier. At the end of the encounter, they gain a Persistent Condition that moves them -3 steps down the Condition Track until they rest for four hours and have a nutritious meal. Should they fall Unconscious while their Fast Healing remains active, they automatically gain Hit Points equal to their Character Level, but still remain unconscious for an hour, after which they awaken and gain a Persistent Condition that moves them -3 steps down the Condition Track.

An EMPS can only be activated once per day, even if the is capable of taking multiple Second Winds. Due its close proximity of this cybernetic to vital organs, a successful attack against the user's Fortitude Defense during Surgery results in a permanent -2 penalty to their Constitution.

This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Fire-Breathing Apparatus Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Rejection Attack Bonus: +12

As intimidating as it is foolish, this insane weapon was created by cybernetic mercenary Tyrant Vox after a vivid fever dream involving a strange winged creature. A user of a Fire-Breathing Apparatus can make an attack in a 3-Square Cone or, as a Full-Round Action, targets all adjacent creatures. Make a single attack roll and compare it to the Reflex Defense of every target within this area (this is an Area Attack). A successful attack deals 3d6 points of Fire damage to the target; if the attack misses, the target takes half damage instead. A target with the Evasion talent takes half damage from a successful attack, and no damage if the attack misses.

Naturally, this terrible device is just as dangerous to the user as everyone else; on a Natural 1, the user immediately catches Fire, suffering 2d6 Fire damage instead of the normal 1d6 per turn. Further, if they fail to Regain Consciousness by 5 or more, or roll a Natural 1 when Unconscious, the Fire-Breathing Apparatus combusts, dealing 4d6 damage in a 3x3 square area centered on the user.

A Fire-Breathing Apparatus is treated as a Simple Weapon by a user, but its close proximity of this cybernetic to vital organs means a successful attack against the user's Fortitude Defense during Surgery results in a permanent -2 penalty to their Constitution. Because of its placement within the body, the Fire-Breathing Apparatus is virtually undetectable by conventional means, usually only found by those specifically looking for internal cybernetic weapons. As such, the user gains a +10 Equipment bonus on Stealth checks to conceal their Fire-Breathing Apparatus.

A Fire-Breathing Apparatus uses a specialized chemical cartridge, which holds enough chemicals for three attacks. Replacing the cartridge takes one minute (10 rounds), and replacement cartridges cost 400 credits.

This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Implant Packages Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Based on a series of Implants popularized during The The Old Republic Era, modern Implant Packages are an improvement upon the classic design that go beyond their initial function to provide a meaningful auxiliary benefit. Although there are rumors of more potent Implant Packages existing, these three are the most common, and share a price point.

  • Cardio Implant Package: Grants a +1 Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense and Endurance checks.
  • Reflex Implant Package: Grants a +1 Equipment bonus to Reflex Defense and Initiative checks.
  • Memory Implant Package: Grants a +1 Equipment bonus to Will Defense and Perception checks.

changes.value: +10 (no attack if both legs are mechanical)

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Integrated Flight System Equipment data created by Wikia user TheMightyWagon.

Rejection Attack Bonus: +10 (no attack if both legs are mechanical)

Based on the relatively new technology of rocket boots, this difficult to master form of flying is a promising long-term investment. When successfully installed, the owner of an Integrated Flight System must first make a DC 20 Acrobatics check every week for the first six weeks after spending at least four hours per day practicing flying with this item in an open environment. For each successful week, they gain +1 Fly speed, to a maximum of 6 squares, after which this item functions identically to a Jet Pack, using Acrobatics instead of Pilot to control their movement.

Talents and Feats applicable to Jet Packs can be used with an Integrated Flight System. A character without two legs, biological or prosthetic, cannot install this cybernetic, and they cannot be properly installed if one leg is biological and the other prosthetic. For an additional 4,000 credits, users take no penalty on Stealth checks why Flying, but reduce their number of charges from 10 to 6.

Due to this cybernetic's location, a successful attack against the user's Fortitude Defense permanently reduces their speed by 2 squares until they can replace or repair their prosthetics. Fuel cells for an Integrated Flight System cost 300 credits each.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +14

The cybernetic replacement eye includes special infrared sensors that allow the host to see not only visible light but also heat signatures. This grants the host Darkvision.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

Biological replacement limbs and organs are often more desirable than mechanical replacements (Such as a Cybernetic Prosthesis), since they require little maintenance and can be fashioned to look natural. Yuuzhan Vong Shapers have widely varying tastes, but few could care less about whether a replacement limb matches the recipient's other limbs.

Once a Replacement Body Part is attached, it performs just as well as the original limb or organ.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

This Bio-Implant gives the recipient some kind of Natural Weapon, whether in the form of bone spurs on the knuckles, claws from the fingertips, or some other kind of extension of the recipient's bone structure. When a creature with this Bio-Implant makes an Unarmed attack, it may choose to use it's Natural Weapons, dealing 1d6 points of Slashing damage, Piercing damage, or Bludgeoning damage with the attack instead of normal Unarmed damage. A creature with this Bio-Implant is always considered armed with it's Natural Weapons.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Threats of the Galaxy

An Anzati creation, the Rhen-Orm Biocomputer is surgically installed into a creatures skull, expanding the user's awareness and allows the user to sense those who have uncommon "Luck." The computer processes information received from a long antenna that protrudes from the user's forehead. The result of this implant is that when the user makes a Survival check to Track an opponent, they add their quarry's Force Point total as an Equipment bonus to their Survival checks. A Rhen-Orm Biocomputer must be installed by a character who possesses the Cybernetic Surgery Feat, and is counted as a Cybernetic Prosthesis.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Threats of the Galaxy

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

The Regenerative Implant coaxes the healing sections of the brain, causing them to work harder to repair damage. The user of a Regenerative Implant recovers twice as many Hit Points as normal from Natural Healing.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

A small creature is placed in, on, or around the heart. It absorbs and separates toxins that make their way into the bloodstream, rendering them inert. A creature with a Poison Filter gains a +5 Equipment bonus to their Fortitude Defense against Poisons.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

The Nerve Reinforcement Implant augments the signals sent from the brain through the central nervous system, making the body's senses difficult to overload through conventional means. The user of a Nerve Reinforcement Implant gains a +5 bonus to their Damage Threshold against Stun damage.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

A Memory Implant reinforces and augments the synapses in the memory centers of the brain, making it possible to recall knowledge locked away in the user's mind. The user of a Memory Implant can reroll any Knowledge check, keeping the better of the two results.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +3

A Subcutaneous Comlink features special sensors and transmitters attached to the vocal and auditory organs of the host. This allows the creature with this Advanced Cybernetic to hear Comlink transmissions and to send his or her own by making only slight vocal sounds. When a being with a Subcutaneous Comlink wishes, he or she can communicate through this Comlink without making a sound loud enough for others to hear.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +16

This cybernetic replacement eye includes enhanced target-recognition software linked with Weapon packages and Armor targeting packages. The eye creates HUD overlays, augmenting the host's vision to enhance combat prowess. A host with a Targeting Eye is considered to have the benefit of a Helmet Package.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +14

The Sensory Enhancement cybernetic package places cybernetic augmentations on nerve endings in various sensory organs, reducing the signal-to-noise ratio and allowing the host to notice what might otherwise have been missed. A character with the Sensor Enhancement cybernetic package reduces by 2 any penalties to Perception checks made to notice a target with Concealment or Total Concealment.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

The Sensory Implant augments the mind's natural ability to process visual data, enhancing the user's ability to perceive targets under difficult conditions. The Sensory Implant grants a user Low-Light Vision; if the character already has Low-Light Vision, he or she gains Darkvision from the Implant instead.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

Designed by Imperial scientist Nasdra Magrody, the Subelectronic Converter is a computerized device that, when implanted into a subject's head, allows the subject to control Droids through The Force. One such recipient of the Cybernetic Device, Irek Ismaren, could mentally visualize a Droid's programming and use his Mind Trick Force Power on them, which normally cannot be done.

A Subelectronic Converter translates the signals from the subject's brain into Binary commands understood by Droids; likewise, it converts Droid signals into a language that the brain can understand.

A Subelectronic Converter is just like any other Cybernetic Enhancement, in that it must be installed by a character with the Cybernetic Surgery feat and imposes a penalty on Use the Force checks. A character with a Subelectronic Converter may use Mind-Affecting Force Powers on Droids, despite the Droids' immunity to Mind-Affecting effects. However, there's a trade off: the recipient of the Subelectronic Converter takes a -2 penalty to their Will Defense due to side effects of the device.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

The Natural Armor Bio-Implant consists of a thick layer of chitin that grows out of the recipient's skin, protecting the recipient from attacks. This Bio-Implant increases the creature's Natural Armor Bonus by +1. If a creature does not have a Natural Armor Bonus, it gains a +1 Natural Armor Bonus. A Natural Armor Bonus stacks with an Armor Bonus.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +9

A Telescopic Eye can zoom in on remote targets, granting the bearer a greater range of distant vision. In some cases this is just a result of visual enhancement software and fine-tuned sensors, but in other cases this can mean that the eye literally detaches from the host and hovers on tiny repulsors closer to the target. A Telescopic Eye allows the host to take Range penalties to Perception checks every 20 squares instead of every 10 squares.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +7

A Tremor Sensor is installed in the feet of the host. Connected to the nervous system, the Tremor Sensor detects minute vibrations in the ground, warning the host of approaching enemies. A creature with the Tremor Sensor enhancement takes no penalty to Perception checks to notice targets that have Concealment or Total Concealment, provided the target moved on it's last turn.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

Rejection Attack Bonus: +12

This cybernetic enhancement package enhances the host's skeleton with high-impact polymers, increasing bone density and the ability to endure high-impact collisions. A character with Skeletal Reinforcement gains a +2 Equipment bonus to their Damage Threshold.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War
